comments.body: Unrelated to the fix itself, but adding more tests to `duplicated` (this test revealed the bug).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +789,793 @@            # index
            for idx in [pd.Index(case), pd.Index(case, dtype='category'),
                        pd.Index(case, dtype=object)]:
                res_first = idx.duplicated(keep='first')
                tm.assert_numpy_array_equal(res_first, exp_first)

comments.body: @gfyoung FYI it seems we have another skip on 32-bit in here as well, so not specific to uint64. I think there is a n issue somewhere. but pretty hard to debug.
This is indicative of a flakiness, but I'm not sure how to secure proper ordering in this case.  I would hate to skip just because we can't ordering right, but I don't see how at this point.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +649,653 @@        result = algos.value_counts(arr)

        # 32-bit linux has a different ordering
        if not compat.is_platform_32bit():
            tm.assert_series_equal(result, expected)
